messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Horrible quote for the week
messages.msgSnippet: ... LOL! I was going to look up the Greek because (a) I didn t think he d used the word teacher and (b) the translation didn t sound like the Aristotle that
messages.messageBody:
>I went to see if I could find that Aristotle quote with the Greek to see what
>was translated as "children," because I seriously doubt he was talking about
>"children" as in 8 year olds or any suchlike.

LOL! I was going to look up the Greek because (a) I didn't think he'd used
the word "teacher" and (b) the translation didn't sound like the Aristotle
that I had read/translated when I was in college (I still have all of my
books up in the attic!) Thanks for finding this alternative translation.



Mahalo,
Barbara

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Horrible quote for the week
messages.msgSnippet: I went to see if I could find that Aristotle quote with the Greek to see what was translated as children, because I seriously doubt he was talking about
messages.messageBody:
I went to see if I could find that Aristotle quote with the Greek to see what
was translated as "children," because I seriously doubt he was talking about
"children" as in 8 year olds or any suchlike.

I didn't find that, but found a different translation, and note a telling
difference:


Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce
them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.
Aristotle



Well well! <g>

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Horrible quote for the week
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, we re homeschoolers, so we do BOTH.  Take that, Ari! Nancy
messages.messageBody:
On Jul 5, 2005, at 5:56 PM, Julie W wrote:

> "Teachers who educate children deserve more honor than parents who
> merely gave birth; for bare life is furnished by the one, the other
> ensures a good life."
> ~ Aristotle ~
>

Well, we're homeschoolers, so we do BOTH. Take that, Ari!

Nancy

messages.subject: Horrible quote for the week
messages.msgSnippet: I just got this quote attached to a weekly newsletter.  I am not sure which bit rankles the most. Teachers who educate children deserve more honor than
messages.messageBody:
I just got this quote attached to a weekly newsletter. I am not sure which bit rankles the most.

"Teachers who educate children deserve more honor than parents who merely gave birth; for bare life is furnished by the one, the other ensures a good life."
~ Aristotle ~

Julie W
Wellington
New Zealand
